results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;United States Politics and Government;Scott, Richard L;National Republican Senatorial Committee;Republican Party
results.title: How a Record Cash Haul Vanished for Senate Republicans
results.abstract: The campaign arm of Senate Republicans had collected $181.5 million by the end of July — but spent 95 percent of it. A big investment in digital, and hyperaggressive tactics, have not paid off.

media.caption: Senator Rick Scott of Florida oversaw an enormous wave of spending on digital ads at the National Republican Senatorial Committee.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, State Legislature;Elections, House of Representatives;Elections, Governors;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Pennsylvania;Wilkes-Barre (Pa)
results.byline: By Katie Glueck and Michael C. Bender
results.title: Trump Lashes Out in First Rally Since F.B.I. Search
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump and President Biden have both made recent appearances in Pennsylvania, one of the key states in November’s midterm elections.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump speaks at his first rally since his home was searched by F.B.I. agents Aug. 8.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Research;Deaths (Fatalities);Nature (Journal);Congo, Democratic Republic of (Congo-Kinshasa);Mount Nyiragongo (Congo, Democratic Republic of)
results.title: A Volcano Erupted Without Warning. Now, Scientists Know Why.
results.abstract: A new study explains how Nyiragongo, a volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo, was relatively quiet before its eruption last year took everyone by surprise.

media.caption: The Mount Nyiragongo volcano near Goma, Democratic Republic of Congo, erupting on May 22, 2021.

results.adx_keywords: Floods;Global Warming;Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Rain;Pakistan
results.title: What Is Owed to Pakistan, Now One-Third Underwater
results.abstract: The Global North can help Pakistan by taking responsibility for the losses and damage of extreme weather fueled in part by the burning of fossil fuels.

media.caption: A flooded residential area in the Dadu district of Sindh Province.

results.adx_keywords: Movies;Actors and Actresses;Venice International Film Festival;Aronofsky, Darren;Fraser, Brendan
results.title: Venice: Brendan Fraser Mounts a Transformational Comeback
results.abstract: In Darren Aronofsky’s “The Whale,” the onetime leading hunk is earning Oscar chatter for his role as a 600-pound recluse, though the emotional actor is wary.

media.caption: Brendan Fraser arriving at the Excelsior Hotel pier on Sunday in Venice.

results.title: Women Are So Fired Up to Vote, I’ve Never Seen Anything Like It
results.abstract: Since Roe v. Wade was overturned, women have registered to vote in incredible numbers.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.copyright: Dolly Faibyshev for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Recalls and Bans of Products;Baby Carriages, Strollers and Carriers;Accidents and Safety;Amputation;Consumer Product Safety Commission;UPPAbaby (Monahan Products LLC)
results.title: More Than 14,000 Strollers Recalled After Child’s Fingertip Is Amputated
results.abstract: Only one case has been reported involving an UPPAbaby All-Terrain RIDGE Jogging Stroller, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

media.caption: Owners of UPPAbaby All-Terrain RIDGE Jogging Strollers are encouraged to stop using them and contact the manufacturer to get free replacement brake discs.

results.adx_keywords: Funerals and Memorials;Politics and Government;Cold War Era;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);International Relations;Gorbachev, Mikhail S;Putin, Vladimir V;Moscow (Russia);Russia;USSR (Former Soviet Union);Ukraine
results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Ivan Nechepurenko
results.title: Russians Mourn Gorbachev in Silent Protest Against an Absent Putin
results.abstract: At the funeral of Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the last Soviet leader, the size of the crowds signaled the depth of the regret about the undoing of the freedoms that his tenure initiated.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Law and Legislation;Campaign Finance;McConnell, Mitch;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Senate;Democratic Party
results.title: With Midterms Looming, McConnell’s Woes Pile Up
results.abstract: The minority leader who takes pride in his status as the “grim reaper” of his rivals’ agenda has allowed Democrats to claim policy victories as his party’s hopes of reclaiming the Senate dim.

media.caption: Senator Mitch McConnell, the minority leader, and a bloc of Republicans in Congress believe they need to win back suburban voters by supporting issues with broad political appeal.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Constitution (US);Books and Literature;Law and Legislation;State Legislatures;Midterm Elections (2022);Conservatism (US Politics);Feingold, Russell D;Santorum, Rick;Arrington, Jodey
results.title: A Second Constitutional Convention? Some Republicans Want to Force One
results.abstract: A new book by a former Democratic senator warns of the risks of allowing states to call for a convention. Some in the G.O.P. see it as the only way to rein in the federal government.

media.caption: Conservative Republicans in Congress are seeking to clear a path for a constitutional convention.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;United States Politics and Government;Voting and Voters;Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships;Polls and Public Opinion;Calvert, Ken;Rollins, Will (1984- );Democratic Party;Republican Party;California;Palm Springs (Calif)
results.title: In the California Desert, L.G.B.T.Q. Voters Could Sway a Key House Race
results.abstract: Representative Ken Calvert, a long-serving Republican, is facing a tough re-election race in a redrawn district that now includes Palm Springs, proclaimed to be the gayest city in America.
des_facet: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

media.caption: Palm Springs was known in its early days as a retreat for Hollywood celebrities and later became home to thousands of gay men who relocated there during the AIDS epidemic.
media.copyright: Adam Perez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Alcoholic Beverages;Politics and Government;Research;Canada
results.title: How Many Drinks a Week Are Safe? Canada Considers a Much Lower Limit
results.abstract: Research to update Canada’s drinking guideline has found that there are no health benefits, only dangers, from alcohol.

media.caption: Research has found that consuming more than six drinks per week greatly increases health risks.

results.adx_keywords: Tests (Medical);Frauds and Swindling;Securities and Commodities Violations;Bribery and Kickbacks;Decisions and Verdicts;Schena, Mark;Arrayit Corporation;Justice Department
results.title: California Biotech Executive Is Guilty in $77 Million Blood-Testing Scheme
results.abstract: Arrayit Corporation claimed to have invented a technology to test for any disease using a drop of blood, including Covid-19 and cancer.

media.caption: Mark Schena served as the president of Arrayit Corporation, a biomedical company in Sunnyvale, Calif., which claimed to have invented a technology to test for any disease using only a drop of blood.

results.title: Man Charged in Abduction of Billionaire’s Granddaughter, Police Say
results.abstract: Eliza Fletcher was last seen early on Friday jogging in Memphis. She was forced into a dark-colored S.U.V. and remains missing, the police said.

media.caption: Eliza Fletcher’s grandfather, Joseph Orgill III, was a billionaire who ran Orgill Inc., a Memphis-based hardware distributor.

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;Arms Trade;China;Taiwan;Taiwan Strait
results.title: China Threatens Reaction After U.S. Announces Arms Sales to Taiwan
results.abstract: A $1.1 billion package would “severely jeopardize” ties, Chinese officials say in demanding that Washington revoke the deal.

media.caption: Taiwanese soldiers during a live-fire drill in Pingtung, Taiwan, last month. The Biden administration just approved the sale of more than $1.1 billion worth of arms to Taiwan.

results.title: Judge Dismisses Suit Over Naked Baby Image on Nirvana Album Cover
results.abstract: Spencer Elden, who was pictured as a baby on the cover of “Nevermind,” argued in his lawsuit that the grunge rock group had engaged in “child pornography.”

media.caption: Spencer Elden says he has grown increasingly uncomfortable with how he came to be on the cover of “Nevermind.” This picture was taken at the same pool in 2016, when Mr. Elden and the record were both 25.

results.title: Paranoia and Pastels at Bama Rush
results.abstract: Fears about TikTok and rumors of a secret documentary swirl around sorority rush week at the University of Alabama.

media.caption: After the sorority rush at the University of Alabama went viral on TikTok last year, the week has taken on new tension.
media.copyright: Jill Frank for The New York Times

results.title: Barr Dismisses Trump’s Request for a Special Master
results.abstract: The former attorney general, who chose not to indict Mr. Trump in the Russia inquiry, said the Justice Department was justified in investigating his handling of government materials.

media.caption: Former Attorney General William P. Barr defended the Justice Department’s search of Mar-a-Lago.

results.title: Town After Town, Residents Are Fighting Affordable Housing in Connecticut
results.abstract: Local residents and elected officials are seeking to block large housing projects, warning that increased density could change the character of their towns.

media.caption: Homeowners have raised about $84,000 for a legal fund to fight a proposed apartment complex downtown on Weed Street in New Canaan, Conn.
media.copyright: Jane Beiles for The New York Times
